intro: Satyrium sphaerocarpum, commonly known as the globe lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, globular thallus that is often covered in a layer of white or yellowish powder. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga or cyanobacterium, which allows it to thrive in various environmental conditions. It is typically found on rock surfaces or tree bark in temperate regions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to mycologists and botanists studying lichen diversity.
